alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Harrison; Pearl River (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 24 at 11:46PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern St. Tammany Parish, Harrison, Hancock and southeastern Pearl River Counties through 1230 AM CST... At 1145 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Kiln, or 7 miles west of Diamondhead, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gulfport, Biloxi, Long Beach, Bay St. Louis, Waveland, Diamondhead, Kiln, Pearlington, Lyman, Shoreline Park, Stennis Space Center, Saucier and Gulfport Airport. This includes Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 2 and 43. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CST for southern Mississippi.
